TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ListControl extends System.Windows.Forms.Control

Docs.summary: Provides a common implementation of members for the and classes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ListControl class provides implementations of common elements for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> controls.
The following properties are of primary concern to users of a data-bound <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox>: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> properties.
## Examples The following code example is a complete application that shows how you can use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> members of the ListControl class as implemented by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> class. The example loads an <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> and the list box. When the user selects an item in the list box, the selected value is used to return the data associated with the selected item.
[!code-cs[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.l_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.l_3_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.l_3_1.cpp)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The DataManager property is valid if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A> property is set. If this is not a data-bound control, the default is `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data source for this .
Docs.value: An object that implements the <xref:System.Collections.IList> or interfaces, such as a or an <xref:System.Array>. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks There are two ways to fill the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> controls.
For example, you can add objects to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.ObjectCollection.Add%2A> method. You can also add objects to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> by using the DataSource, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> properties to fill the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox>.
When the DataSource property is set, a user cannot modify the items collection.
If setting the DataSource property causes the data source to change, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSourceChanged> event is raised. If setting this property causes the data member to change, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMemberChanged> event is raised.
When you set DataSource to `null`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A> is set to an empty string ("").
## Examples The following code example is a complete application that shows how you can use DataSource, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> members of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> class as implemented by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> class. The example loads an <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> and the list box. When the user selects an item in the list box, the selected value is used to return the data associated with the selected item.
[!code-cs[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.l_53_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.l_53_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.l_53_1.cpp)]

Docs.exception: The assigned value does not implement the <xref:System.Collections.IList> or interfaces.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A> changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the DataSourceChanged event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl>, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox>. Then name the instance `ListControl1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the DataSourceChanged event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#142](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.windows.forms.l_35_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#142](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.windows.forms.l_35_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the property to display for this .
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> specifying the name of an object property that is contained in the collection specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A> property. The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The controls that inherit from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> can display diverse types of objects. If the specified property does not exist on the object or the value of DisplayMember is an empty string (""), the results of the object's `ToString` method are displayed instead.
If the new display member cannot be set, the previous display member setting is maintained.
## Examples The following code example is a complete application that shows how you can use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A>, DisplayMember, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> members of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> class as implemented by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> class. The example loads an <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> and the list box. When the user selects an item in the list box, the selected value is used to return the data associated with the selected item.
[!code-cs[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.l_38_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.l_38_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.l_38_1.cpp)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Format event is raised before each visible item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> is formatted. Handling this event gives you access to the string to be displayed for this list item, through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ConvertEventArgs.Value%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControlConvertEventArgs>.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the Format event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl>, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox>. Then name the instance `ListControl1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the Format event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#144](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.windows.forms.l_9_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#144](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.windows.forms.l_9_1.vb)]

Docs.value: The <xref:System.IFormatProvider> implementation that provides custom formatting behavior.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Setting the FormatInfo property will override the default formatting behavior, which uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.CurrentCulture%2A> setting.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether formatting is applied to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A> property of the .
Docs.value: if formatting of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A> property is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Setting the FormattingEnabled property to `true` causes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.Format> event to be raised for each visible member of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl>.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A>, and FormattingEnabled are related as follows:
- If FormattingEnabled is `false`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will not be set to -1 when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> is blank.
- If FormattingEnabled is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will be set to -1 when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> is blank.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:

Docs.param: An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnDataSourceChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract int SelectedIndex { get; set; }

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item.
Docs.value: A zero-based index of the currently selected item. A value of negative one (-1) is returned if no item is selected.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the member property specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> property.
Docs.value: An object containing the value of the member of the data source specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a property is not specified in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A>, SelectedValue returns the results of the `ToString` method of the object.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A>, SelectedValue, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> are related as follows:
- If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> is `false`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will not be set to -1 when SelectedValue is blank.
- If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will be set to -1 when SelectedValue is blank.
## Examples The following code example shows the SelectedValue returning the value of the property specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> property. This code is an excerpt from the example shown in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> class overview. See <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> for the whole code listing.
[!code-cs[ListControl#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.l_7_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControl#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.l_7_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[ListControl#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.l_7_1.cpp)]

Docs.exception: The assigned value is or the empty string ("").

Docs.summary: Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example is a complete application that shows how you can use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> members of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> class as implemented by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> class. The example loads an <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> and the list box. The example also uses the SelectedValueChanged event to fill in a text box when the user selects an item in the list box. The text box is filled with the data associated with the selected item.
[!code-cs[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.windows.forms.l_33_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.windows.forms.l_33_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/e-system.windows.forms.l_33_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the specified array of objects in a collection in the derived class.
Gets or sets the path of the property to use as the actual value for the items in the .
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> representing a single property name of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A> property value, or a hierarchy of period-delimited property names that resolves to a property name of the final data-bound object. The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks Specify the contents of the ValueMember property in cases where you bind data.
You can clear the ValueMember property by setting the property to an empty string ("") or `null`.
Setting a new ValueMember property raises the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMemberChanged> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValueChanged> events.
## Examples The following code example shows loading the data into an <xref:System.Collections.ArrayList> and setting the ValueMember to a property of the object in the list.
[!code-cs[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.l_10_1.cs)] [!code-vb[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.l_10_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[ListControl#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.l_10_1.cpp)]

Docs.exception: The specified property path cannot be resolved through the object specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the ValueMemberChanged event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of a type that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl>, such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox>. Then name the instance `ListControl1` and ensure that the event handler is associated with the ValueMemberChanged event.
